translation.text:
Trains are suspended and replaced by buses between Bankstown and Sydenham in both directions due to urgent overhead wiring repairs at Belmore. Customers travelling from the affected stations to the City can also catch Light Rail service from Dulwich Hill or local bus (Routes 420, 418, 423, N10) to complete their journey. Major delays can be expected. Frequent shuttle trains are operating between Bankstown and Liverpool and also between Sydenham to City. Some T4 line services will do an additional stops at Erskineville and St Peters. 

Repair crews are on site and working to restore train services as soon as possible. At this stage we do not have a forecast of when the line can be reopened. We will provide further information as it becomes available. Please allow plenty of additional travel time, listen to announcements check indicator boards and transport apps before boarding services.

Due to planned weekend trackwork buses also replace trains between Lidcombe and Bankstown.

Services resume from Monday 2 March between Mt Victoria and Springwood, after earlier landslip at Leura. Buses replace trains between Lithgow and Penrith this weekend due to planned trackwork. 

Buses will continue to replace trains between Mount Victoria and Lithgow for an extended period of time due to infrastructure damage caused by the recent bushfires. Please listen to announcements, check platform screens and Transport apps for updates. You can also plan your trip at transportnsw.info/trip to see how these changes affect you.
Sydney Mardi Gras Parade - Saturday 29 February 2020

Sydney Mardi Gras Parade 2020 - Oxford St & Flinders St - Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst and Moore Park
19:00 to 23:30
- Trains will run to a Saturday timetable, with additional services to get you to the parade in the evening and home again.
- The closest stations to the start of the parade are Central, Town Hall, Martin Place, St James and Kings Cross, depending on which side of the parade you want to be on.
- Note: Museum Station will be closed and trains will not stop from 17:00 on Saturday until 04:00 Sunday due to large crowds and road closures in the area for the parade.
- Planned trackwork may affect how you travel to the event with buses replacing trains between Emu Plains and Penrith on T1 Western Line and between Lidcombe and Bankstown on T3 Bankstown Line. Buses are also replacing trains between Lithgow and Penrith on Blue Mountains Line.
- Additional late night services will run from Central, Town Hall, St James and Martin Place stations to help you get home after the parade. Keep in mind that trains don't run all night on Mardi Gras, so if you¿re heading home after 01:00 on certain lines you may need to catch a NightRide bus instead. 

Details: https://transportnsw.info/events/2020/02/sydney-gay-lesbian-mardi-gras-parade-2020

Chipping Norton Race Day - Royal Randwick Racecourse, Randwick
12:30 to 18:00
- The closest station to the Racecourse is Central. Change for a light rail service to Royal Randwick leaving from Chalmers Street stop.

Farmer and the Owl music festival - MacCabe Park, Wollongong
12:00 to 23:00
- The closest station to the event is Wollongong on the South Coast Line. The park is approximately 1km walking distance from the station.

NBL: Sydney Kings v Melbourne United - Qudos Bank Arena, Sydney Olympic Park
19:15 to 21:15
- Valid pre-purchased match tickets include travel on Sydney Trains and Sydney Metro services.
- Trains run from Lidcombe to Olympic Park every 10 minutes until midnight.

A League: Newcastle Jets v Perth Glory - McDonald Jones Stadium, Broadmeadow
17:15 to 19:15
- The closest station to the Stadium is Broadmeadow on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line. The stadium is within short walking distance of the station.

Sydney Sail GP 2020 - Shark Island, Sydney Harbour
16:00 to 18:00
- The closest train station to Rose Bay and Vaucluse is Edgecliff on the T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line. From Edgecliff connect with a route bus service along New South Head Road.

Details: https://transportnsw.info/events/2020/02
Erskineville, St Peters Due to urgent overhead wiring repairs at Belmore.
due to urgent overhead wiring repairs at Belmore. Limited buses are in operation between Sydenham and Campsie.
due to a customer disturbance and police operation at Strathfield earlier.
Due to urgent overhead wiring repairs at Belmore. Limited buses are in operation between Sydenham and Campsie.
Wentworthville, Pendle Hill, Toongabbie, Seven Hills, Doonside, Rooty Hill, Mt Druitt due to an animal on the track at Kingswood earlier.
due to an animal on the track at Kingswood earlier.
Erskineville, St Peters Due to urgent overhead wiring repairs at Belmore.
The escalator between the suburban and intercity platforms is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9379 1777.

Customers, due to Wynyard station upgrades the lifts from George Street to Concourse Level will be closed until July 2020.   During these works, Customers will be able use alternate lifts from Wynyard Station to Carrington Street and York Street accessed via Margaret Street.  For further information or assistance, Please follow station staff instructions, station signage or call Wynyard Station on 9224 2959.
The lift between the concourse and Harvey Road is temporarily out of service.
The lift between the concourse and bus bay E is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9765 1161.
The lift between the footbridge and Anderson Ave/Marco Ave is temporarily out of service
The lift between platforms 1/2 and the concourse is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9224 2959.
The lift between the concourse and Vera street is temporarily out of service. For assistance, ask staff or call 4223 5864.

Drop-off zones on Kirkham Road alongside platform 1 will not be accessible until June due to scheduled council roadworks. An alternative drop-off zone is available at the Station Car Park located on Station Street.  Please allow additional time in order to catch your service.

The public toilets at Beverly Hills station are currently unavailable while major repairs take place. Temporary toilets have been provided and are located outside the station on Tooronga Terrace. These facilities can be accessed during staffed hours. We apologise for any inconvenience.
Due to urgent overhead wiring repairs at Belmore, all T4 Line trains will do an additional stops at Erskineville and St Peters as to provide regular service.

Museum station is closed until 04:00 Sunday. Trains will not stop at Museum during this time due to large crowds and road closures for Sydney Mardi Gras Parade. Please use St James station as an alternative.

The public toilets at St James Station are closed while major works are taking place. Public toilets are located at the Elizabeth Street entrance to the right and in Hyde Park through the Macquarie Street tunnel up the stairs to the right. We apologise for any inconvenience.

New Metro Platforms are being constructed on platforms 1 & 2 at Sydenham Station. T3 Bankstown Line services to the City operate from platform 3 & T3 Bankstown Line services to Lidcombe and Liverpool operate from platform 4. Platform 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works - A new Metro concourse is also being constructed at the Northern end of the station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please see staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info

Station Upgrade - Customers, due to Wynyard station upgrade the lifts from the concourse level to George Street will be closed until July 2020. Customers will be able use alternate lifts from Wynyard Station to Carrington Street and York Street accessed via Margaret Street.  For further information or assistance, Please follow station staff instructions, station signage or call Wynyard Station on 9224 2959.
